experiences.title: Mentorship of Trainees
experiences.institution: The Hospital for Sick Children and University of Toronto
bulletPoints: PhD co-supervisor: 1 student (2024–present, co-supervised with Dr. Peter Dirks)
MHSc research practicum supervisor: 2 students (2024–2025), and (2025–2026)

Research mentorship: providing conceptual feedback and advice, helping with experimental design, monitoring progress, and sharing feedback on their results; 3 PhD students, 3 PhD rotation students, 2 MSc students, 6 summer students.

experiences.title: Course Coordinator and Lead Instructor
experiences.institution: Advanced Human Genetics (MMG 3001Y), Department of Molecular Genetics, University of Toronto
bulletPoints: [Lead instructor and coordinator] for a two-semester core [graduate course] in the Master of Health Sciences (MHSc) in Medical Genomics program, enrolling approximately 22–25 students annually.
This includes hands-on teaching, mentorship, and course coordination, and conveying complex material in an accessible way over a sustained period of time (1 or 2 terms).

experiences.title: Co-Organizer and Instructor
experiences.institution: Low Input Epigenomics Workshop, Welcome Genome Campus, UK
bulletPoints: Co-organizer and lead instructor (CUT&RUN and CUT&Tag module) of this competitive, international 8-day [workshop] for senior PhD students, postdocs, and early-career investigators.
Delivered comprehensive and hands-on theoretical and laboratory training on epigenomic profiling in rare cell populations and low-input samples.
